metadata.title: CVE-2017-7810 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory safety bugs were reported in Firefox 55 and Firefox ESR 52.3. Someof these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that withenough effort that some of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code.This vulnerability affects Firefox < 56, Firefox ESR < 52.4, andThunderbird < 52.4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 56.0+build6-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '56.0+build6-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.4.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
